like some of the solutions are highly highly penalized they're very costly so those are like the mountain peaks and

lowest Valley or valleys in the landscape the way a classical computer sutras through that is effectively
extraordinarily fast iterations so it's just running through the landscape picking particle by particle and saying

fast but the trick is that the landscape has to to the number of qubits space in
it so if you've got like a 300 bit system it's got two to the three hundred possible solutions that's more than the
estimated number of particles in the universe five billion a second is not going to get you anywhere so the notion
with a quantum computer is that you have a quantum memory register and every
single point in the landscape could be one memory location in the memory register like all zeros are all ones and
you're going to use that quantum memory registers to sort of quantum mechanically superimpose itself across
the entire space of solutions and then you're going to ask it to start to localize and as its localizing and
converging in on individual solutions it's also running away from the high mountain peaks and collapsing into the
valleys flowing a little bit like water and the interesting thing about it is that quantum mechanics allows it to
tunnel from one valley to another without having to flow over top of the mountain peaks in between so that's the
